entry.title: Self-cultivation
entry.content:
Study hard and take control of yourself.

Be diligent in practice and shape yourself.

Strictly demand and perfect yourself.

Rules to becoming better

  1. 保持定期整体
  2. 随身携带一支笔，一包纸
  3. 找到适合自己的社交圈子，不适合自己不强迫
  4. 无论什么时候，宁可早到也不要迟到
  5. 多说“谢谢您”
  6. 拿东西用完一定要放回原位
  7. 多喝书 2500 ml
  8. 多想少说
  9. 不要随便显露自己的情绪
  10. 不要常常反悔或轻易推翻自己已经决定的事情
  11. 任何成果和成就都应和别人分享
  12. 必须有人牺牲或奉献的时候，自己走在前面
  13. 做不到事情不要说，说了就努力做到
  14. 检讨任何过失的时候，先从自身或自己开始反省
  15. 虚心接受别人批评
  16. 懂的进行自己我对话，自己评估
  17. 正确认识自己的缺点
  18. 不要抱怨别人，别总指责别人
  19. 不要浪费时间不断地向别人解释自己
  20. 少胡思乱想
  21. 珍惜时间
  22. 真诚待人
  23. 懂的感恩
  24. 要心存敬畏
  25. 尽量自己做饭，少吃外卖
  26. 多吃水果多吃菜
  27. 三餐按时吃
  28. 你可以有高期待，但也最好也准备承受高失望
  29. 有具体的目标
  30. 拒绝拖延，始终自律
  31. 要有诚信，忠义，善良
  32. 早睡早起
  33. 屏蔽无所谓的朋友圈，退出很水的社群，停止无效的社交
  34. 谦虚低调
  35. 要有平常心，耐心，信心
  36. 提升厨艺

entry.title: Flerdimensionell analys
entry.content:
Grundläggande begrepp, analytisk geometri och funktioner

  1. Vad menas med en inre punkt respektive randpunkt till en mängd $M$ i $\mathbb{R}^2$?
  2. Vad menas med att en mängd $M$ i $\mathbb{R}^2$ är a) öppen, b) sluten, c) begränsad, d) kompakt? Ge exempel.
  3. Hur inför man a) polära koordinater i planet, b) rymdpolära koordinater?
  4. Vad menas med en funktion från $\mathbb{R}^n$ till $\mathbb{R}^p$? Ge några exempel då $p = 1$ och några exempel då $n = 1$.
    Betrakta funktioner från $\mathbb{R}^2$ till $\mathbb{R}$. Vad menas med grafen till en sådan funktion? Ge exempel. Vad menas med en funktionsyta? Vad är värdemängden? Ge exempel. Vad menas med en nivåkurva?
    Betrakta funktioner från $\mathbb{R}^3$ till $\mathbb{R}$. Vad menas med grafen? Vad är värdemängden till en sådan funktion? Ge exempel. Vad menas med en nivåyta?
    Betrakta funktioner från $\mathbb{R}$ till $\mathbb{R}^2$? Vad är värdemängden?
    Förklara hur en cirkel (eller annan kurva i planet) kan beskrivas med hjälp av en funktion från $\mathbb{R}$ till $\mathbb{R}^2$
    eller med hjälp av en funktion från $\mathbb{R}^2$ till $\mathbb{R}$.
  5. Låt $f$ vara en funktion från $\mathbb{R}^2$ till $\mathbb{R}$. Vad menas med att $f (x, y) → A$ då $(x, y) → (a,b)$? Vad menas med att $f$ är kontinuerlig i $(a,b)$? Vad menas med en kontinuerlig funktion?

    Differentialkalkyl, lokala undersökningar och optimering

  6. Vad menas med att den reellvärda funktionen $f (x, y)$ är partiellt deriverbar i punkten $(a,b)$? Vilken är den geometriska betydelsen av de partiella derivatorna i detta fall?
  7. Ange en ekvation för tangentplanet till ytan $z = f (x, y)$ i punkten $(a,b, f (a,b))$.
  8. Vad menas med att funktionen $f$ från $\mathbb{R}^2$ till $\mathbb{R}$ är differentierbar i en punkt $(a,b)$? Vad menas med differentialen i en punkt? Ge en geometrisk tolkning av differentialen.
  9. Visa att om funktionen $f (x, y)$ är differentierbar så är den också a) kontinuerlig, b) partiellt deriverbar.
  10. Formulera kedjeregeln för en sammansatt funktion av formen
    a) $h(x, y) = f (g(x, y))$,
    b) $h(x) = f (g_1(x), g_2(x))$,
    c) $h(x, y) = f (g_1(x, y), g_2(x, y))$.
    Bevisa b).
  11. Definiera vad som menas med gradienten av $f$ , om $f$ är en reellvärd funktion av flera variabler. Ange en geometrisk tolkning.
  12. Definiera begreppet riktningsderivata för en reellvärd funktion av två variabler. Ange en formel för beräkning av riktningsderivatan. Bevisa formeln.
  13. I vilken riktning har $f (x, y)$ sin maximala tillväxthastighet, och hur stor är denna? Bevisa ditt påstående.
  14. Bevisa att vektorn grad $f (a,b)$ är normal till kurvan $f (x, y) = f (a,b)$ i punkten $(a,b)$.
  15. Hur kan resultatet i föregående fråga användas för att bestämma en ekvation för tangenten i $(a,b)$ till kurvan? Generalisera till ytor och tangentplan.
  16. Ange alla funktioner $f (x, y)$ i planet som uppfyller den partiella differentialekvationen $\frac{\partial f}{\partial x} = 0 $.
  17. Formulera Taylors formel av andra ordningen för en funktion av två variabler och skissera beviset.
  18. Vad menas med att en reellvärd funktion av två variabler har lokalt maximum (minimum) i en punkt $(a,b)$?
  19. Definiera begreppet stationär punkt för en funktion av flera variabler.
  20. Bevisa att en lokal inre extrempunkt för en reellvärd, partiellt deriverbar funktion av två variabler är en stationär punkt.
  21. Vad menas med att en kvadratisk form $Q$ på $R^2$($R^3$) är a) positivt (negativt) definit, b) indefinit, c) semidefinit? Ge exempel på sådana former i två och tre variabler.
  22. Antag att $(a,b)$ är en stationär punkt för funktionen $f (x, y)$. Vilka slutsatser om funktionens uppförande i en omgivning av $(a,b)$ kan man dra med hjälp av den kvadratiska formen i Taylorutvecklingen av $f$ i $(a,b)$?
  23. Hur går man tillväga för att bestämma det största (minsta) värdet av en funktion $f (x, y)$ definierad på en kompakt mängd i $R^2$ ? Vilken sats utgör den teoretiska grunden för metoden?
  24. Studera något exempel på hur man genom avskärning ibland kan återföra optimeringsproblemet över en icke-kompakt mängd på det kompakta fallet.
  25. a) Betrakta problemet att söka maximum av en funktion $f (x, y)$ under bivillkoret $g(x, y) = 0$. Visa att om $(a,b)$ är en maximipunkt så är vektorerna grad $f (a,b)$ och grad g(a,b) parallella.
    b) För praktiskt räknebruk kan resultatet i a), och motsvarande i tre variabler, formuleras antingen med Lagranges multiplikatormetod eller (ibland) med en determinant. Hur går detta till?

    Differentialkalkyl för vektorvärda funktioner

  26. Hur bestämmer man tangenten till en kurva som parametriseras av funktionent $t→ \textbf{r}(t)$? Fysikalisk betydelse?
  27. Låt f vara en funktion från $R^n$ till $R^p$. Vad menas med dess funktionalmatris och funktionaldeterminant (om $n = p$)? Vad menas med linjäriseringen av $\textbf{f}$?
  28. Formulera implicita funktionssatsen i fallet $F(x, y) = C$ om man vill lösa ut a) $y$ som funktion av $x$, b) $x$ som funktion av $y$. Motivera med en figur.

    Integralkalkyl och användning av integraler

  29. Formulera två varianter för beräkning av en dubbelintegral som itererad enkelintegral.
  30. Skriv upp formeln för variabelbyte i en dubbelintegral. Förklara de ingående beteckningarna och ange förutsättningarna.
  31. Vad menas med en Riemannsumma? Vad händer med en sådan då indelningens finhet går mot noll?
  32. Beskriv några metoder att beräkna trippelintegraler.
  33. Hur beräknar man volymer med användning av dubbelintegral? När kan man ha nytta av att använda trippelintegral?

    Vektoranalys i planet

  34. Hur beräknar man en kurvintegral direkt enligt definitionen?
  35. Ge en fysikalisk tolkning av begreppet kurvintegral.
  36. a) Formulera Greens formel med alla förutsättningar.
    b) Bevisa formeln i fallet $Q = 0$ och $D = {(x, y); ϕ1(x) ≤ y ≤ ϕ2(x), a ≤ x ≤ b}$ (formel (9.8) i läroboken).
  37. Ge exempel på att Greens formel i allmänhet inte kan användas om förutsättningarna saknas i någon punkt.
  38. Härled med hjälp av Greens formel en metod att beräkna arean av ett plant område.
  39. Vad menas med ett potentialfält (konservativt fält) och vad menas med en potential? Vad menas med en exakt differentialform?
  40. Hur går man tillväga för att bestämma potentialen till ett konservativt fält?
  41. a) Visa att för ett potentialfält $(P,Q)$ med potentialen $U$ ärom $(x_0, y_0)$ och $(x_1, y_1)$ är start- respektive slutpunkt på kurvan $γ$.
    b) Av a) följer att för ett potentialfält är kurvintegralen oberoende av vägen.
    Gäller omvändningen?
  42. a) Visa att om kraftfältet $(P,Q)$ är ett potentialfält så är $\frac{∂P}{∂y}=\frac{∂Q}{∂x}$. För att även omvändningen skall gälla krävs att fältet är definierat i ett område $Ω$ med en speciell egenskap. Vilken?
    b) Skissera beviset för att likheten $\frac{∂P}{∂y}=\frac{∂Q}{∂x}$ medför att fältet är ett potentialfält under denna extra förutsättning.
    c) Ge exempel som visar att utan denna extra förutsättning kan man inte dra några slutsatser.

entry.title: Conway's Game of Life
entry.content:
Conway Game of Life, a game about life. It was first proposed by the British mathematician John Horton Conway in 1970 as a cellular automaton. The so-called cellular automata can also be understood as a zero-player game. It is not like the “normal” game, which it does not requires too much operation. When we enter a certain initial value, the Conway Game of Life will run in accordance with the established rules and will not accept any parameters until the end of the game (unfortunately, you cannot win in the Conway Game of Life). When the game starts to run, we only need to observe how this life works, just like when we were child and we were quietly watching ants on the steps.

“So, do you user java, python, c# or what?”
Me: “Oh I use CGOL(Conway’s Game of Life)”

In Conway’s Game of Life, everything has a meaning, because it has the Turing completeness. In other words, any problems that may be solved with computers can be solved with Conway’s Game of Life. This was first proved by Bill Gosper in 1970. Although it rarely appears in our lives but they are still equally significant. In the game of life, we can also explore the real situation of life closer.

Rules of life

In this world live life, in a two-dimensional rectangular world. life has only two state, they can only be live (yellow) or dead (gray). The life and death of a life at the next moment depends on the number of lifes alive or dead in the eight adjacent squares.

  1. Life is afraid of loneliness
    If there are less than two lives around a life, it will die at the end of the round
       
  2. Life hates crowding
    If there are more than three lives around a life, it will also die at the end of the round
       
  3. Life can reproduce
    If there are three lives around the dead grid, it gains life at the end of the round
       
  4. Life like lagom
    If there are 2 or 3 lives around a life, it will stay the same at the end of the round
       

It is not difficult to find that the rules of Conway’s Game of Life are as familiar as the rules of our lives in this world.

To know life

There are different states of life

Still lifes

BlockBeehiveLoafBoatTub

pseudo still life, strict still life

Oscillators

Beacon (period 2)star (period 3)pinwheel （period 4）pentoad （period 5)Kok’s galaxy ( period 8)

Spaceships

Spaceships are an interesting state in Conway’s Game of Life.

Glider speed c/4Lightweight spaceship c/2David Eppstein 2c/7119P4H1V0 c/4Spaghetti monster 3c/7

Explore more life

Can life reproduce indefinitely?

From this point of view, it seems that a finite life cannot produce an infinite number of lives. This is also a conjecture that Conway started with this game:

Conway originally conjectured that no pattern can grow indefinitely—i.e. that for any initial configuration with a finite number of living cells, the population cannot grow beyond some finite upper limit

But this problem was quickly resolved. The answer to this answer is “Yes, life can reproduce indefinitely”.

Life and chaos

Life in life

Create a game of life in the game of life, and so on, then you can construct the game of life in the game of life…This reminds me of the most basic unit of this world that constitutes our world, anyway let we call it a string. The world of strings is equivalent to the most basic Conway game. Strings vibrating at different frequencies produce different elementary particles. This is equivalent to creating a game of life with the game of life. After that, different elementary particles have constructed our world today.

This result is not surprising, after all, the rules of the game of life come from nature. Life is so amazing.

I mean just imagine, just imagine if, if the world we are living right now is kind of game of life for the high dimensional creature…………

entry.title: How to study systematically
entry.content:
Here I want to write in detail about my personal systematic learning method. Generally prefer individual self-study.

1. Input and thinking

There are many books in this world, and it is impossible for us to finish reading every book. Of course, books can be good or bad. Picking out a good book or the book you want is trying to read a book roughly. Rough reading can also be understood as fast reading. The main purpose is to simply look through the table of contents, the table of contents, pictures, and tables in the book, and to get a general understanding of the content, key points and points of interest in the book. Sometimes reading personal information about the author can also help you understand the nature of a book better.

When you find a book then everything is ready. In the process of reading, at least for text books, I personally like so-called intensive reading. This is the process of reading a book from thin to thick. This means that every time you read a book, you are not just reading the superficality of the book, but trying to understand and think about the meaning behind each word. Whenever you don’t understand, look up relevant information and leave notes in the book. So slowly you will find that you have read this book thickly.

2. Notes and summary

In terms of notes, I have tried many different solutions. From the paper notes to the electronic notes. From messy methods to Cornell notes. From this, I slowly discovered a system of my own.

At this stage is a process of reading the book from thick to thin. Simply, it is to digest the knowledge you have learned and retell it in the most brief and easy way. So notes are particularly important. I personally use the form of electronic notes, it is a combination of the so-called Ipad + Apple Pencil. In this respect, I think electronic notes have more advantages than traditional notes. First, electronic notes are easier to organize and carry. The second is its versatility and convenience, so there is no need to bring a lot of crayons and so on. Of course, it also has disadvantages. Compared with traditional notes, writing experience and dependence are incomparable.

I personally like to write on notability. In taking notes, I use The Cornell Note-taking System.

The Cornell Note-taking System.pdf

详细介绍细节与做笔记的过程

3. Emphasis and reflection

When you finish taking notes, then you highlight the key points and essence of this book.
Then try to ask your self:

  • What is the point of view of this knowledge?
  • What is their basis?
  • How do i apply them to things I already know?
  • What else I might not have thought of, other people or the author have not thought about?

4. Output and improvement

In this regard, I personally think Feynman’s learning method is a very good method. You are in an input state during your learning process. Then the Feynman learning method is an output state. If a person understands the input but can’t express himself simply to express what he has learned, I think it is a pity.

“The person who says he knows what he thinks but cannot express it usually does not know what he thinks.” — Mortimer Adler

Richard Feynman, the late Nobel Laureate in physics, was once asked by a Caltech faculty member to explain why spin one-half particles obey Fermi Dirac statistics. Rising to the challenge, he said, “I’ll prepare a freshman lecture on it.” But a few days later he told the faculty member, “You know, I couldn’t do it. I couldn’t reduce it to the freshman level. That means we really don’t understand it.”

As Feynman once said, if a person cannot simply express what he has learned, then he does not understand it at all. Feynman’s learning method is not only an output function, it also has a function that allows you to reflect on what you have learned.

The Feynman learning method is divided into the following four steps:

  1. Be clear about what you want to learn
  2. Use simple language to tell what you have learned.
  3. If you get stuck in the process of telling, review what you have learned
  4. Make your explanation easier to understand, and the language becomes more simplified

The ultimate goal of Feynman’s learning method is to allow you to use your own language to explain what you have learned instead of those hard scientific terms.

About the exercises

I have had this experience

When I was doing the exercises, I couldn’t figure it out when looked at the solution, I could understand everything and then sighed: “I almost thought of this step! Ah, this is so simple, why and how can’t I figure it out? What…”

I guess there is also a bad problem I have now.

I can do the problem but always careless either writing down the wrong question or calculating the wrong number.

I had this problem since high school and I haven’t really reflected on why. 个人认为主要原因还是归根于知识掌握的不牢固另外一个是心态问题。还有就是因为“积累不够”，而且“思考得不够”。接触到题目中的某个信息，它给你指出了一个知识点后，因为没有体系，所以难以主动联系（联想）到其他的知识。积累不够是大脑中没有形成体系，所以知识都是零零散散的，想要用的时候不知道用哪一个。

How to make myself better:

  1. Do again or reflect on the exercise that you got the wrong answer, it can make you think more rigorous.
    It is inevitable that you will make mistakes when doing the exercises. After reviewing the answer, it is necessary to understand why I did something wrong, and reflect why. If necessary,then record the wrong solution in detail at Error manage book.

    Error Manage Book

  2. Training of proper difficult problems can expand the capacity of thinking.
    Do the exercises as much as possible. Remember, there is no need to do the exercises that you already understand or know, which is a waste of time.

  3. Explain to others, this is an effective way to consolidate your knowledge
    Kage Bunshin no Jutsu

Well, one lives and learns. Finally, I would like to cite Confucius’s famous quote to summarize this section

“学而不思则罔，思而不学则殆。”-孔子
“Learning without thinking leads to confusion;thinking without learning ends in danger.” -Confucius

This sentence comes from Confucius and is also a method of reading and learning that he advocated. This means that if you blindly read books without thinking, you will not be able to use the knowledge of the books reasonably and effectively because you do not deeply understand the meaning of the books, and you will even get confused. If you blindly think about it without actually studying and understand into it. It just like building a tower on the sand and gain nothing at the end.

复习

The buff

Concluded

graph TD    A(input) --> B(Understanding)    B --> C(summary)    C -->|reflection| B    C --> D(Output)    D -->|improvement| C

entry.title: 2021, I am ready
entry.content:
2020 is an extraordinary year. During this year, I have experienced a lot, grew a lot, and learned a lot. In the face of the sudden outbreak of COVID-19 pandemic, it changed everything suddenly. During this period we were all forced to take “cloud lessons” and I was also forced to take classes at home. At the beginning, there were a lot of things that I was not used to, but it gradually became numb, and did not care that much. At the same time during the pandemic I also learned a new instrument, the violin. Another important event that changed the direction of my life was that in July I got the offer from the Uppsala University. This also mean that I will start a new life in Uppsala. In September, I came to this strange city alone. A city with no friends, no relatives, and no reliance is here to start my new life. I learned that how to reads alone, study alone, think alone, cook alone, and live alone. Perhaps that is what growth up mean. Time rushed into December, and a short semester passed. I still do not regret my decision. In life, I think is should go around and see more, learn more about the new environment, and open horizons about the world.

On New Year’s Eve, I am alone in the dark and empty room to write this blog. I am not a traditional person or person who has a sense of ritual. Although 2020 is indeed extraordinary, I hope that this new year 2021 will also have new hope, new motivation, and new meaning. Time flies really fast, and my 21 years have passed like in a moment. We all say goodbye to the people and things in the past at that crossroad. While I looking back now, it only myself is around. The journey of life is so far, I hope to meet a better myself in the front.

I have set a few goals in this new year.

  • Start the four theoretical mechanics and understand them
    • Quantum mechanics
    • Electrodynamics
    • Theoretical Mechanics
    • Statistical Mechanics
  • Participate the college physics competitions
  • As in previous years, I still need to improve my English
  • the world is so big I want to see and travel around especially China
  • Better biological clock, better time management, better character
  • Stay away from social media
  • I want to read more books this year and learn more.
  • Improved my violin skills

Don’t forget to love yourself in this strange city.

2020是一个不平凡的一年，在这一年经历了很多，成长了很多，见识了很多。面对突如其来的新冠肺炎，我们都防不胜防。在这期间我们都被迫上“云课”，我也被迫在家上课。刚开始有很多东西不习惯，但慢慢的也就麻木了，无所谓了。同时我疫情期间也学习了一件新的乐器，小提琴。另外一个改变我人生方向的重大事件是在七月份我拿到了乌普萨拉物理系的录取通知书。这也将意味着我要在乌普萨拉开启新的生活。今年的九月我孤身一人来到这陌生的城市。无朋友，无亲戚，无依靠的城市这来开启我的新生活。我学会了一个人看书，一个人学习，一个人思考，一个人做饭，一个人生活。或许那就是成长把。时间匆匆忙忙到了十二月，短短的一个大学学期就过去了。我仍然没有后悔当初的决定。人生把，我觉得就应该多去看看，多去了解一下新的环境，开开自己的眼界。

新年前夕我一个人在乎黑忽暗,空虚的房间写这篇文章。我并不是一个传统的，有仪式感的人。虽然2020的确不平凡但我希望这这新的一年也有新的希望，新动力，以及新的意义。时间过得真的很快，匆匆忙忙我的21年如同一刹那间度过。曾经的人，曾经的事我们都在那十字路口里告别。如今回过头来,周围只剩我自己。人生路程如此遥远，希望在前面遇见更好的自己。

在这新的一年里我立下几个目标。

  • 开始四大力学，以及了解他们
    • 量子力学
    • 电动力学
    • 理论力学
    • 统计力学
  • 参加大学物理比赛
  • 像往年一样，我英语还是需要有待提高
  • 我想回中国看看，世界那么大我想去看看
  • 更好的生物钟，更好的时间管理，更好的人品
  • 远离社交媒体
  • 有时候我发现我读的书很少，我想在这一年内读多些书。
  • 提高的我小提琴的技巧

在这陌生的城市别忘了爱自己。

entry.title: Daily planning & time management
entry.content:
尽量写完！

Background

The concept of time is important

有时候我意识到人这一生很短暂，有很多事情我们都来不及做。虽然每个人拥有的时间是一样，毕竟每个人都以小小小于光速运动着。那么真正能改变一个人的时间就是做事情的效率以及合理的安排。 简单来说我们管理时间的目的就是为了提高时间的利用效率 它能够延长我们生命的长度。

我本并不是一个高度自律的人， 但我想通过这样的方式去改变我自己。

Self-reflection

一下是我个人总结的一些小经验

Daily planning

The morning

The most energetic and concentrated time of the day

04:00 | Wake up |

God Morning!

04:00-04:30 | Morning exercise |

—Wake up the body—

When you wake up in the morning, your body is usually still stiff, and the most natural wake-up mechanism is “stretching.” But what we have to take is to further awaken the whole body, such as: esay exercise, meditation.

04:30-05:15 | Writing blog, planning and reflection |

The unexamined life is not worth living. -Sokrates

Indeed, understanding reflection can make oneself stronger. At the beginning of a new day, our mentality will be more peaceful, and we will be more rational when thinking and reflecting on things. Therefore, there will be a fairer and calmer attitude to reflect on what happened yesterday. This makes it easier for us to find what needs to be corrected and improved.

—Start the brain—

Simple planning:
1.Write a morning diary. It mainly records what happened the previous day and is worth recording, as well as reflections.

  1. Write a plan for the day. Organize the to do lists, and fill blockytime
  2. Write blog.

05:15-05:45 | Out and walk |

Just a short walk to freshen up. I guess you will be tired, so go out and get some fresh air! (optional)

06:00-07:30 | Study 1.5h |
Now is the time to study!

7:30-7:45 | Breakfast |

Preferably a porridge with protein drink, eg milk or soy drink. As well as a fruit !!

8:00-12:00 | Study 4h |

Time to study

The day

高效

12:00-13:00 | Foodtime and lunchbreak |

I have no choice with that time for lunch. If it is a regular lecture day, I am free from 12:00 to 13:00, which is then suitable for lunch and lunch puash.

13:00-13:30 | Take a naps |

I have tried other times to take a nap in the afternoon. I think the optimal time is between 13: 00-13: 30. If it’s later than that, I’ll get really tired, then I will not keep it in time. Sometimes it happens that I take a too long nap maybe 1h30min. As a result, I can not sleep at night.

Regardless, I think taking a short nap is a good recovery for the day. Especially for me who wake up early in the day. If in that case you miss that time, I recommend not to do it on another occasion. You can instead have a cup of coffee or similar.

13:30-17:15 | 4h. |

study

17:15-18:00 | Sports / Reading / Violin |

I would like to have an aerobic workout every other day. In the best case, it is every day. The sport I like most is cycling and jogging. Jog at least 5km. So far, I have no good optimal for how much I have to cycle.

If not, I want to have that time to read or practice the violin!

18:00-19:00 | Other |

Here you have the time for a few other things. Very important and make good use of it !!

The evening

The time is controllable, the mood is relaxed and happy, and does not affect early going to bed.

19:00-19:30 | Foodtime and short break |

Time for supper. I usually only cook in the evening. So the time will vary a little now and then. On average, I need 1 hour and a little more to cook.

19:30-21:30 | Free times |

DO whatever you want.

21:30 | Prepare to bedtime |

For the last half hour, I want it to the shower and toothbrushing.

As well as absolutely the most important, mediation or any way you can relax, or reduce stress. !! Very important !!

Another thing I experienced where it can interfere with my sleep was the telephone. Avoid the phone 30 minutes before going to bed. It’s important !!

22:00 | Bedtime and goodnight |

Turn off the lights and sleep. Going to bed early is the basis for you to get up early the next day. Sleeping at a fixed time every day helps to adjust the biological clock, to ensure that you have a better state to face the challenges of the next day, so that your mind is calm, creative and efficient.

Sum Up

  • Minimum 6 hours sleep and optimal 7.5h
  • Preferably a hot drink before I go to bed
  • Try to meditate at least once a day
  • Exercise at least 4 times a week
  • Study 8h
  • Max 2 cup coffee per day

3 sorted of Time

简单讲述这三种时间以及在这时间段我都想达到什么样的目的！

Whole piece of time

Fragments of time

Use fragmented time to create miracles

“Dark time”

I wanna scroll with it, baby!

Excellent app

Tide - Sleep. Focus. Relax. Breath.

BlockyTime - A simple time logger no need to tap Start/Stop.
Microsoft To Do - Focus, from work to play
Focus To-Do - Be focused and make things easier.

vetenskaplig förklarining
planer’
https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Time_management
这是一句话[1]

  1. hejed ↩

entry.title: Funktionsteorin
entry.content:
Bakgrund

Funktionsteorin så kallas även komplexa analys. Här är mina anteckningar från boken funktionsteorin av Frank Wikström. Det var en riktigt spännande bok som guida dig genom harmonisk analys och komplexa analys inom matematiken. Här kommer jag inte skriva härledning till satserna utan hänvisas jag till boken. Notera att även författare har inte hellre härledat strikt bevis för de mesta satser pga det är för tekniksk och komplex.

1. Komplexa funktioner

Innan vi går vidare till derivator skall vi sätta ett definetion om gränsvärde för komlexa funktion. gränsvärde för komplexa funktioner har ungefär exakt samma pricip som den reellla funktion.

Anta att $f$ är en komplexvärd funktion som är definera på någon omgivning av punkten $z = a$. Så gäller gränsvärde för komplexvärd funktion

Om det finns till varje $\epsilon > 0$ finns ett $\delta > 0$ sådana att

för alla z med 0 < $|z-a|<\delta$

De vanöiga relltvärdes gränsvärde räknelagar gäller även sammma för komplexvärda funktioner. Alltså

2. Elementära funktioner

Komplex plynom

3. Komplex integralkalkyl

4. Talföljder och rekursionsekvationer

5. Serier

6. Funktionsföljder och funktionsserier

7. Fourierserier

8. Potensserier och analytiska funktioner

9. Singulariteter

10. Residykalkyl

entry.title: What is the meaning of self-control?
Who am I? where I come from? where I want to go?
entry.content:
Who am I ?

“knowing yourself is the beginning of all wisdom.” -Aristotle

“knowing other is wisdom knowing the self is enlightenment” -Lao Tzu

More than two thousand years ago, some people already began to think about self-consciousness. Aristoteles(384–322 BC) and Lao Tzu (600 BC) were the most famous ideologists and philosophers at the same period. The thing which surprised me is Lao Tzu came from Ancient China, meanwhile Aristoteles was från Ancient Greece and they both realized the importance of self-identity. Since these two independently developed civilizations can have such the same ideas. It really surprised me. This kind of wisdom may not be truly understood by many people in today’s society. What I believe people nowadays pursue more material life than spirit of life.

Where I come from?

I know that is stupid quation. Everyone knows what themselves come from. Many people will say I am coming from some country or maybe they can specify where in the country in which city and road and so on. But do they really know where they

Where I want to go?

“I come from the great Tang dynasty of the east land and I’m going to pilgrim the budda for lection.” -Tang Sanzang

This quote is coming from the chinese novel “Journey to the West”, it is one of the four great classical novels of chinese literature. This novel was published in the 16th century during the Ming dynasty and talked about the story of Tang Sanzang and his apprentices Sun Wukong, Zhu Bajie and Sha Wujing and going to the west to learn the scripture. Later it adapted from a novel into a TV series. As a child this was one of my favourite TV serier. I am atheist but this story really impacted me a lot.

This sentence is difficult to express its essence in other languages than chinese. It it little werid when I read it in english.

entry.title: Why I chose physics, Especially theoretical physics?
entry.content:
First inspiration about physics

The first memory that I actually know about the concept physics is at junior high school. To be honest, in the three year I don’t even know that I had a physics teacher but this did not make me lose my interest in physics.

When I was in second grade at junior high school I readed “The Quantum World” by Kenneth W. Ford. This book makes me think about physics and what is the fundamental of this universe(Sorry Hawking, your book “brief history of time” was not inspiring enough). In this book, I was the first time I really realized how fascinating and beautiful this universe is. In that moment I also realized how ignorable we are to compare the whole universe. The main reason I like physics is it makes me think and be curious all the time. From that day I decided to work with physics like “quantum” stuff or “particle” stuff that even I did not really know what this is. I never was a genius in physics or something. Maybe in my age when I was a child that Albert Einstein already began to think about the universe and I was the little poor boy sitting down in the sandpit and playing in the sand.

I want more challenge and more physics

When I was in the third year of junior high school, I was confused about choosing high school. Most of the people in my class choose a high school near home. In this case, I was the special case, I want to leave home, leave from my parents. I am very lucky and met my SYV or school counselor. She was kind and helped me a lot with how to choose high school. So far I am still very grateful to her. Without her I may not be here, my physics passion may be gone, who knows. Finally, I had a choice for my high school, Polhemskolan at Lund, with orientation gift education in physics. Actually, I had no idea what this meant, but what I knew is my high school would not be bored and I will meet a lot of people with the same passion as me.

That summer I was nervous and waiting for my admission to high school. The day before I could not fall asleep. I woke up early in the morning and updated the admissions website time and time until they uploaded admission notices. At that moment, I am happy and proud of myself. I came in Polhemskolan at Lund.

Polhemskolan, another inspiring place


At Polhemskolan I learned a lot. I had a nice three year there. There I got the elementary knowledge of math and physics. We had study visits e.g. nuclear power at Barsebäck, MAX IV Laboratory, European Spallation Source (and CERN). During the education, we also had the opportunity to take a step at university. We had many lectures from Lund University and we did laboratory work at Lund University. In that way, my perspective on the physical world increased.

It turned out that I was very bad at study physics when I started in high school. I remembered that I stuck to the concept acceleration for several weeks before I fully understood it. It is similar to other concepts like energy conservation and other basic physics concepts. Which is really ridiculous. Sometimes I was so sad and frustrated but I never gave up. No matter how frustrated I was, my physics passion never went away. A quotes from Lao Tzu “ The journey of a thousand miles begins with one step.” gave me a lot of motivation. Sometimes you can not reach the goal directly. You must do it step by step. That makes me enjoy physics in another way.

“People who knows how to study is inferior to people who likes studying; people who likes studying is inferior to people who takes studying as joy.” - Konfucius

It’s interesting for me to think about physics, but the process of learning physics makes me feel more fulfilled.

I think the most important thing I actually learned from polhem was my learning ability. Another advantage of that education was that you can start reading courses at the university level already in high school.

Mathematics is my favorite dessert

从我记事起我觉得我的数学一直都很不错。至少我觉得数学这科目在学校中我觉得是最简单的。虽然我并没有得过什么重大的奖但也是一种喜好吧。

在高二的时候我对于数学的认知有了天翻付地的变化。有时候我觉得我之前我学的数学并不是真正的数学而是‘算数’。在某种意义上来说，我懂的如何去计算一道题，但我几乎好像从来都没刨根问底的去想这背后的意义是什么。我记得那一年我第一次接触到大学数学，微积分。那一年也是我数学的一次考试未及格。

有一次考试对我印象很深刻。那是一门muntan，主要就用用语言去表达这道题的解。那一天我心有成足的去考试，一般大概也就是10分钟。可结果是我和那教授足足坐在那讲了45分钟。从那开始我才认识到我是那么的愚昧与无知。我非常感谢那位教授，是他让我见识到我在数学大厦目前我是多么的弱小。同时也让我看到了数学的不同的角度。

从那以后我就抱了以往不同的心态，以及严谨的态度去学数学，真正意义上的数学。有时候我也曾问过我自己学数学有什么用。其实也没什么用，就像吃甜点那样。爱数学就觉得他好吃，好玩。

I don’t know what theoretical physicist means but it sound fun

说我懂物理其实也不然。懂的也只是一知半解。我了解理论物理学家大多数要不然就是书上或者网上。在现实生活当中我并没有认识过一名真正的理论物理学家。甚至连物理学家到底真正在做什么都是一头雾水。有时候看书的时候觉得那些理论物理学家，比如爱因斯坦，霍金，费曼等人都很酷。所以也就励志的想成为一名理论物理学家。

其实理论物理学家

What I think about real physics v.s. popular physics

It was a interesting sentence that I found on the internet. “Nature magazine’s thickening speed has exceeded the speed of light, but this does not violate the special theory of relativity, because it does not convey any information.” What I think, that makes sense. The more physics I read and know, the more I think that popular science is a fairy tale in the physical world.

entry.title: What do I expect to learn during the three years at university
entry.content: A semester has passed when I write this article.

entry.title: Experimental determination of the maximal lyapunov exponent of the magnetic pendulum
entry.content:
Abstract:

The magnetic pendulum has a simple structure but a complex chaotic behaviour. Since a system has a positive maximal lyapunov exponent is strong indicates that system is chaotic. The studies of magnetic pendulum have been mathematically and numerically understood. Unfortunately, it is still lack of experimental examination of the lyapunov exponent of magnetic pendulum due the extreme and sensitive requirement. In this project is studied about the maximal lyapunov of magnetic pendulum experimentally. The study is not extensive and specifics for the chaotic behavior of magnetic pendulum. However, the result are showed the magnetic pendulum has a positive maximal lyapunov exponent about 28 1/s with a given parameter. Which is strong indicates that magnetic pendulum has a chaotic behaviour.

entry.title: GitHub + LaTeX make more efficient for writing and collaboration
entry.content:
There has always been a problem that bothered me, how to write $\LaTeX$ by multiple people. I consulted a friend of mine and he told me that Git is a solution. I have tried Git many times but failed, mainly because it is difficult to get started after all. Until about a few weeks ago, my group was going to write a report in LaTeX. Then I found thought of my friend’s suggestion (actually I don’t want to spend money on overleaf), try to use Git to assist multi-person editing. I didn’t know how to operate it at the beginning, so I try and try until it success. This blog is my personal summary about Git, and avoid some unnecessary detours. I have not yet fully mastered Git, and I am still studying-ing…

Preparations

Before we start you need to prepare few things

  • Git (optional)
  • GitHub (optional)
  • $\LaTeX$ (optional)
  • and passion (optional,of course)

Let's GO!!

Git

What is Git and what are the benefits of Git?

Git is a version control system primarily intended for use with program code. In short, Git is a tool for collaborating on code that makes it possible to handle changes and history.

Some benefits of Git [1]

  • Keep track of all files in a project
  • Record any changes to project files
  • Restore previous versions of files
  • Compare and analyze code
  • Merge code from different computers and different team members.

Install Git

For many novices, installing Git is not an easy task. On Linux, you only need to execute this command in the terminal.


Emm, it doesn’t seem to be that difficult.

If you are using Microsoft, Mac or other computer operatingsystem please check out how to install Linux at your computer before you continue. Just kiding..

Have fun with Git

1 Create a local git repository

The first thing you need to do is to create a git repository in a folder.


Remember, that folder is the best empty folder.

Later you can use this command to see if you have successfully created a git repository.


Please remember this command, because you may need it often later. The function of this command is simply to check the current git status. If you enter this command you will see

Later I will explain step by step what is branch, add and commit.

Note: When you create a git repository, it will generate a .git folder in your folder. This folder is generally invisible. In Linux, you can press ctrl+h to display it.

2 Create a new file to the repository

In the Git repository you can create a file manually or you can


Actually, there is nothing special or important here. Now we can try git status to see what happens.

You see an extra test.text in untracked files. This is the essence of git, and it also involves the functions of add and commit. See you in the next chapter.

3 Use Add and commit to track

Here we going to learn the powerful tracking function of git. add and commit will also be the most commonly used commands. Then let’s talk about what add and commit are, and what their functions are. Here we have to understand three areas, namely Working Directory, Staging Area and Git repository. And their corresponding three states of git, namely modified (modified the file, but not yet saved in the repository), staged (marked the current version of a modified file), committed.

Git workflow

  1. Working Directory
    It holds the actual file, which is the directory where you save the actual file. Here you can modify your files as usual, and any files are created and modified in the workspace. Remember that the files in the working directory are not saved in the git repository hence it cannot be version controlled.
  2. Staging Area
    It is like a cache area and temporarily save changes of your files. Any modification is version controlled after entering the Staging Area. If you add them to the staging area, you can execute the following commandIf you have completed the above command, then you have marked the current version of a modified file to a file in staged state. It is ready to be sent to the git repository.
  3. Git repository
    When your file is in the staging area, you can use the following command to send your file to the Git repository.Now the file test.text is in state committed and the data has been saved in the local Git repository.

    Remember here you need to know that you are now sending to a local git repository instead of a remote git repository. Later I will explain the difference between the two repository.

    Sometimes it is very troublesome, that is, you have to execute add and then execute commit. You can try this so that you don’t need to enter add and commit separately.

    This command can save you 0, 1 second of your life.

4 The branch

If you know how to use branch cleverly, this will greatly improve your work efficiency. When you create a local repository, “master” branch is the default branch or main branch. The advantage of branches is that when each branch is independent between each branch during the development process. If during the development process of one branch fails, it will not have any impact on other branches and main branch. Just delete the failed branch and start again. As the owner of the branch, you can merge the two branch at any time. Of course, the most important thing is that branch can effectively avoid unnecessary conflicts.

In the picture we see the master branch and two branches, let call them feature and feature . Imagine you want to develop a new feature. Then you can divide this feature into two small features for independent development, which are feature and feature. When you are finish with one of them, then you can merge them into the master branch. Simply, branch can effectively help you divide big problem into different small problems and then merge them into the main branch. If one of the feature is failed to develop, it will not affect the entire project. At the same time, you can imagine that if there is no branch, then you have to develop all new features in the main branch. If there is a mistake in the development process, the final result may be irreversible.

Creating a branch is simple, just type

Every time you create a branch, it is equivalent to copying your current branch.

Then you can switch to a different branch, by using this command

Here I have collected some common commands about branch

5 Overwrtting with merge

Earlier we introduced branches and how to create branches. Then they can be overwritten between different branches. Simply put, the merge command merges different branches. If you want to write something in one branch and then merge to another branch, you can use this command

Unfortunately, not all mergers can be successful. Conflicts will appear in many merge situations. This is because you make different changes to the same part of the same file in two different branches, Git cannot merge them cleanly, and conflicts will occur. If conflicts appear, the only solution is that you need to modify these files manually. After the modification, you need to execute the following commands to mark them as modifie resolved successfully git add <filename>.

5 Advanced of Git (can be skipped)

GitHub

What is Githut and waht is difference between GitHub and Git?

Git is the bow, your code is the arrow, and Github is the target.

Simply, git is a software, it is also a local “warehouse” at your pc where you can save different versions of the code and documents. GitHub is an online “warehouse”, where you can also save your code and its version.

Create an GitHub account

I won’t introduce it in detail here, see GitHub official website.

Create a repository at GitHub

We already know how to create a lokalrepository, that is use the command git init. All you need to do now is to create an online repository. The advantage of online repository is that can be shared and edited by multiple people.

In Git you can create two different types of repositories, public and private. Public is equivalent to open source, so everyone can download your repository. If you want to use GitHub for group work or study, it is best to use a private repository. In this repository, only invited people can edit and view.

Keep in mind that rules about cheating and plagiarism may make it necessary to use private repositories for group work!

Configure and work with Git

If you are using Git for the first time, you first need to configure it. Simply put, you have to tell the computer who you are and who is using this Git. The following command is to tell Git who you are

When you are done, you can use this command to check if you are success

When you have created a repository at GitHub. Then you can send your local files from your lokal repository to the online repository.

Conclution and some common commands

Here is some bacis commands that you shuold master it.

For more and detalj information pleace click here

Edit $\LaTeX$ together with Git

I know who did what, when, and why. -Git


Now you are ready for the Workflow with Github!

  1. 创建一个git文件夹，并包含texfil
  2. 发送到GitHub
  3. 通知你的队友以及把GitHub的网站分享给他们
  4. 队友们pull

最后说几句

其实Git强大在于它并不限制与tex 文档，

References

  1. https://rubygarage.org/blog/most-basic-git-commands-with-examples ↩

entry.title: From zero to 1, how to create your own blog
entry.content:
Background

Why I want strart writing blog

Creating a blog was an idea I had in few weeks ago. I tried many times before and after but all ended in failure. Recently, my idea of creating a blog has become stronger and stronger. Accidently I found out that I can create my own blog by using GitHub. And there is what you see now.

Before I was a person who relied heavily on social media. Every time I turn on the phone, the first thing I do is watch video, post and check what others have done aimlessly. At that moment I don’t feel my-self. In this era of “information explosion”, I found slowly that I became unable to think independently. So I gradually stay away from various social media such as Facebook, WeChat, QQ, etc. The main reason why I stay away from them is very simple because they give me innutritious information all the time.

I hope that in this blog I can quietly be my-self and write down my true feelings. Here I hope I can think freely, without considering other people’s feelings. This is also my original intention of creating this blog. In addition, I also want to record every moment of this young man, after all you are still worth remembering in this rushed world. Whenever this young man wants to look back, at least there are stories that belong to him, and some of his whimsical thoughts.

2020-12-14

Z.H.

How to create a blog using GitHub and Hexo

In this page I gonna introduce how to use Github and Hexo to build your own static website or blog. Attention, all the install here is based on operatingsystem Linux disto Ubuntu 20.04.1. Let’s go it will be fun and fun.

GitHub

Short intro about GitHub and why GitHub

If you never use GitHub before then to https://github.com/ and create an account. There are some avantage to build a blog.

  • It is totally free and convenient.
  • Due the static file, it has fast access speed.
  • GitHub has versioncontrol functionality. Hence your data of each version of your blog is safe and you can restore it if you want.
  • You can do and design whatever you want.

Create a repository at GitHub

Loggin at GitHub and click New repository. Here you must pay attention that your name of repository must be 'your username'.github.io. Otherwises it would not work. I mean it still work..but not enough elegant.

Hexo

What is Hexo and why you need it?

Basically Hexo is a blog framework that allows you to quickly build a blog. In my case I chose Hexo because it is fast, concise and efficient. Hexo is written by Node.js and it also supports Markdown and many other packages. Hence you actually don’t need that much programming och computer knowledge like HTML、css、JavaScript etc. The only thing you should learn or feel familiar with is Markdown. Of course if you want your blog to look prefekt and beautiful that is strong recommend that you master the basics programming language like HTML.

Install Hexo

This installation is based on operating system Linux distro Ubuntu. The first thing you have to do is install Node.js. You can do it by using following command in terminal:

cURL:


Wget:

After the installation is complete, restart the terminal and execute the following commands to install Node.js.

When it is finish then you can use npm to install Hexo.

First Blog and configuration

When Hexo is finished installed, then you are prepared to build your own static website/blogg.
First create a empty folder:


then install Hexo into the folder

If you write this command at terminal then you will see your blog.

What this command do it generates a lokal server for your blog. Usually this is your lokal server http://localhost:4000, if you click on it you will see

Yeee, your website is created!!! Easy, right? Let move on!!!

Attention: you maybe have to execute this command before you execute hexo.

Next thing you have to do is configure your website. After Hexo is install at your folder, you will se a document with name _config.yml. I know it looks complex but don’t give up. We will go through this document step by step and show how you configure your website.

To be honest, you can ignore most parts of the document. The most important part is the first 7 rows. Here is an example of mine. Here you just need to give basic information about your blog like title, language, timezone and so on.

Sometimes you may need to change _config.yml depending on what plugin you want to add to your blog. Therefore it is best to choose some easy theme from the beginning.

Deploy Hexo at GitHub

Above I showed you how to install hexo and create a website. Now you may want to publish it. To do it you have to deploy to GitHub first and install the deployment plugin. To install he deployment plugin you can do with following command:


If you never used GitHub and git before then you must configure git. Like:

Then you go back till_config.yml and you will find deploy below the document. Then filli


When you are finish, then in the root directory of the local Hexo site, execute the following commands to deploy to GitHub:

For each time you publish your blog you can use this easy command

It stands for hexo deploy and generate.

Tadda, looks how easy it is. Now you publish your website successfully. There are few more things that I want to show you, first you may notice your website does not look beautiful. Hence the next step is how to change the theme so your blog looks more elegant. Second is about the domain name of your website. A great domain name makes more people remember your site and also gives your more confidence.

Install theme

I my case I use theme fluid. This is a Material Design style theme. In this link you can find all themes for hexo, in case you do not like fluid.

Some functionality of fluid

  • Image lazy loading
  • Custom code highlighting scheme
  • Built-in multiple languages
  • Support multiple comment plugins
  • Support the use of data files to store configuration, smooth upgrade
  • Custom static resource CDN
  • Built-in article search
  • Footer filing information
  • Web page visit statistics
  • Supports LaTeX mathematical formulas (Oh yeah~)

You can click this link to install theme fluid for the latest release version. After downloading, extract it to the themes directory and rename it to fluid. Then change theme: fluid in _config.yml. After that you have to create about site.


And then you will se a document at /source/about/index.md and addlayout.

For more information about how to change the outlook, please have a look at the fluids website.
